name: AzurePowerShellAzCli
description: Run a PowerShell script within an Azure environment
author: FISCAL Technologies

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceNameARM
inputs.label: Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Resource Manager subscription to configure before running PowerShell

inputs.name: ScriptType
inputs.label: Script Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Type of the script: File Path or Inline Script

inputs.name: ScriptPath
inputs.label: Script Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of the script. Should be fully qualified path or relative to the default working directory.

inputs.name: Inline
inputs.label: Inline Script
inputs.defaultValue:
# You can write your azure powershell scripts inline here. 
# You can also pass predefined and custom variables to this script using arguments

inputs.name: ScriptArguments
inputs.label: Script Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Additional parameters to pass to PowerShell.  Can be either ordinal or named parameters.

inputs.name: errorActionPreference
inputs.label: ErrorActionPreference
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the value of the ErrorActionPreference variable for executing the script.

inputs.name: FailOnStandardError
inputs.label: Fail on Standard Error
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, this task will fail if any errors are written to the error pipeline, or if any data is written to the Standard Error stream.

inputs.name: TargetAzurePs
inputs.label: Azure PowerShell Version
inputs.helpMarkDown:
In case of hosted agents, the supported Azure PowerShell Version is: 1.0.0(Hosted VS2017 Queue).
To pick the latest version available on the agent, select "Latest installed version".

For private agents you can specify preferred version of Azure PowerShell using "Specify version"

inputs.name: CustomTargetAzurePs
inputs.label: Preferred Azure PowerShell Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Preferred Azure PowerShell Version needs to be a proper semantic version eg. 1.2.3. Regex like 2.\*,2.3.\* is not supported. The Hosted VS2017 Pool currently supports Az module version: 1.0.0

messages.InvalidScriptArguments0: Invalid script arguments '{0}'. Line breaks are not allowed.
messages.InvalidScriptPath0: Invalid script path '{0}'. Invalid path characters specified.
messages.InvalidAzurePsVersion: The Azure PowerShell version '{0}' specified is not in the correct format. Please check the format. An example of correct format is 1.0.1
messages.JS_Stderr: PowerShell wrote one or more lines to the standard error stream.
